resources.string: Store personal notes, contact info or questions for the speakers
Your notes will be displayed here, after you save them with a click on save. Keep in mind, this storage is not very persistent!
To support us, ping one of the organizers on our slack

WTMB Ambassadors is a community of volunteers working with external speakers and tutors.\nOur meetups are possible not only thanks to us but also thanks to the wonderful support, that we receive from Google and companies that are listed below. This is our contribution to making Berlin\'s tech scene diverse and inclusive!
We are open to collaborations! \nPlease reach out via form linked below.

This App was created as learning project that would benefit the community Women Techmakers Berlin 💻. 
It is a great place to start an adventure of becoming an open source contributor! Check the issues list in our GitHub Repository, some are labeled with `good first issue`. Support us by adding a pull request 🚀 
 
👨‍💻 👩‍💻 
 
Feel free to submit issues, pull requests or to create forks:
Organizers and community members about WTMB
WTM Berlin is part of the global \nWomen Techmakers program \nrun by Google

At WTM Berlin we are encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. We offer visibility, networking and resources to help you make the tech community of Berlin more diverse and inclusive! Our activities include intense coding study groups, workshops on technical topics and social skills, as well as inspirational fireside chats. New and existing members are always welcome at all events, and all events are always open to everyone, regardless of gender/age/race/experience, etc. We follow the Berlin code of conduct for communities: http://berlincodeofconduct.org
No upcoming events at the moment. Stay tuned!
We are active across social media!
You will find all our events on Meetup, open to RVSP:

A private Slack group is one of the most successful initiatives of our community - it has become a platform to connect with other members, to spread the word about interesting open positions in #jobs channel and to offer your skills in the channel #CVs. The channels #general and #random make it possible to reach out to more diverse Tech audience, for example to announce free/discounted diversity tickets or scholarships.
There is a Facebook page and group but we primarily encourage to sing in to our Slack.

We are all unpaid volunteers supporting a tech community. Please respect our time! RVSP responsibly and if you can\'t make it to the event - just update your choice on Meetup. \nThis helps us estimate size of the events for the company, catering service and the attendees.
If you have a skill to offer, like supporting one of our Study Groups on Android, Go, JavaScript or to give a one-time workshop on the topic of your expertise, reach out via slack

Smartphones with Android Operating System support many accessibility features by default. It is up to developers to add the rest - there are some build-it tools that are ease to use and communicate with other teams:
Accessibility Scanner can be used for captioning the screen ratio contrast and detection of missing labels

For adding some basic accessibility support to the project, follow a few simple steps. Begin with adding meaningful labels for custom designed elements (back arrows, check-marks) and provide content descriptions for the remaining drawables and images. Then set importantForAccessibility=no for design elements that will not be useful for the user in the screen reader user mode and shall therefore be excluded. To learn more visit:
If you had any questions, accessibility remarks, or other feedback, submit an issue or reach out via Slack to one of our organizer with WTM icon symbol next to the name

You can write a blogpost that will be displayed on our website. Submit it in the MARKDOWN format via a Pull Request to our GitHub repository that is linked below. Simply copy the contents from one of the previous posts, edit it to your story and submit as a Pull Request.
Anna is a Jr Android Developer and WTM organizer, co-wrote this app.
Miquel supported our community as an organizer and a tutor during the Android, Kotlin and Flutter study Jams, always sharing his enthusiasm on community work.

Natalie, Women Techmakers Berlin lead about the origins of our WTM Chapter.
Lara\'s interview at the International Women Day, YouTube

Lara, Android Engineer and Google Developer Expert on Flutter. This interview was recorded shortly after her graduation from Android Study Jam. Lara supported our community by co-organising Flutter Study Jam on mobile development!

Maria\'s blog post on the Women Techmakers blog

Maria\'s blog post of switching from a chemist background to a JavaScript developer after attending JS Crash Course. In the following year not only Maria stayed in the community, she contributed by organized the next JSCC edition!
